title: Digital-Based Formative Feedback Design: Utilizing Interactive Feedback Loops

context.prior_knowledge: Proficiency in basic mathematical concepts and foundational ability to use digital tools
context.additional_context: A Course to Strengthen Mathematics Teaching Competencies for Pre-Service/In-Service Teachers. Environment with Access to Digital Devices (Tablets/Laptops). Weekly Face-to-Face Classes + Asynchronous Online Activities

learning_goals: Learners can periodically engage in interactive feedback loops with peers/instructors using weekly digital feedback tools with over 80% consistency
Learners can analyze feedback content and develop three or more improvement strategies for mathematics instructional design
Learners can submit self-reflective feedback through a GoingOK-like web application with over 80% participation rate

resources: Access to GoingOK-like digital feedback platforms

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
